meanings.definition: To place or arrange (something) in a way that is not straight or correct.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally misaligned the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter had to fix the misaligned door hinges.
meanings.sent3: The misaligned picture frame made the room look crooked.
meanings.sent4: His priorities were misaligned, causing confusion in his life.
meanings.sent5: The misaligned wheels on the cart created a bumpy ride.

meanings.definition: To cause (something) to be out of proper alignment.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind misaligned the satellite dish.
meanings.sent2: Improper lifting can misalign your back muscles.
meanings.sent3: The misaligned puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions misaligned the project timeline.
meanings.sent5: The misaligned gears in the clock caused it to stop ticking.

meanings.definition: To be out of line or out of proper position.
meanings.sent1: The rows of chairs were misaligned after the event.
meanings.sent2: His thoughts were misaligned with reality.
meanings.sent3: The misaligned traffic cones confused the drivers.
meanings.sent4: Her misaligned expectations led to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The misaligned planets created chaos in the solar system.
